name: lime production, milled, loose | lime | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/5131/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of milled lime. IInfrastructure data are estimated based on a tour and sketches of the process. The value of the infrastructure is normalized with a annual production capacity of about 6'000 tons of product per year. ;This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of milled lime. Infrastructure data is estimated based on a tour and sketches of the process, and then normalized with a annual production capacity of about 6'000 tons of product per year. 

From the reception of crushed limestone for mill, at the factory gate.

The activity ends with the milled lime. The dataset includes the different production processes (milling, sieving, filtering and storing), the energy consumption for buildings heating and the infrastructure used in the production process.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/081:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay/0810:Quarrying of stone, sand and clay

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data is based on a Swiss company.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The current Swiss technology is considered. The company works on a technically high level; heavy machines (excl. building machines) are operated electrically; air is recirculated in closed loop to avoid dust emissions
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data is based on a Swiss company, for the year 2001.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Limestone is a naturally occurring mineral that consists principally of calcium carbonate but may also contain magnesium carbonate as a secondary component. It is found in many forms and is classified in terms of its origin, chemical composition, structure, and geological formation. Limestone occurs widely throughout the world and is an essential raw material for many industries.
Limestone is generally used for construction, cement, quicklime, agriculture, metal refining and flue gas desulphurisation:

Construction: Limestone is the most widely used crushed rock, although it is generally sold in form of sand and gravel.

Cement: The production of cement is the main use for chalk, and a major use for dense, high-calcium limestone. Approximately 1.1 t of limestone is required for 1 t of cement.

Quicklime: Approximately 1.8 t of limestone is required per 1.0 t of quicklime.

Agriculture: Many crops grow best under neutral to slightly acid conditions (i.e., pH between 6 and 7). Thus soils which are more acidic than pH 6 generally benefit from the application of limestone.

Metal refining: When limestone is used in metal refining it is initially converted to quicklime, which reacts with acidic oxides (e.g., SiO2, Al2O, and Fe2O3) to produce molten slag.

Flue gas desulphurisation: A growing use of limestone is in the treatment of flue gas from combustion processes to remove sulphur dioxide.

Estimation, based on company data. The total amount of crushed limestone for mill used in 2001 was 6.048t. Losses due to dust emissions were neglected.

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature, (Vionnet, S., Quantis Water Database - Technical Report, 2012). The crushed and washed limestone is entering the process. The water use in this process is the one used in ball/rod mill and wet screening. The evaporation rate of 29.2% is calculated based on Byers. The process ends when milled loose limestone is leaving the plant. It is based on general data on ball/rod mill for any kind of rock.

Estimation, based on company data. The oil consumption for grinding drying for the year 2001 is considered. The total amount is 2.45L/t and the fllowing calculations were done:

2.45 l/t = 0.00000245 m3/kg = (density = 860 kg/m3) 0.002107 kg/kg = (calorific value = 42.6 MJ/kg) 0.089758 MJ/kg
EcoSpold01Location=CH

EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. The equipment included in the infrastructure are 1 crusher, 1 sieve, and 2 small silos and 1 filter. The total weight is 34t. The lifetime considered is 25 years.
